answers.answer: hi Therethe most common paraneoplastic syndrome associated with ovarian cacner is the development of blood clots (thrombosis and pulmonary embolus0.another common syndrome is a brain degeneration called cerebellar ataxia,Diabetes is not considered a paraneoplastic syndrome.It sounds like you are having a good evaluation. Your pain may be directly related to endometriosis which is a benign condition. If there is any diagnostic uncertainty, a laparoscopy is worth considering.best wishes

question: How common is it for a paraneoplastic syndrome to develop before ovarian cancer is discovered?  I am having a paraneoplastic panel done soon at the Mayo Clinic, and through my research I have seen that it is often linked to reproductive cancers like testicular or ovarian.  I am a 22 year old female with a strong history of Insulin-resistant PCOS (diagnosed at 15), Endometriosis, and severe uterine bleeding that resulted in a D&C and insertion of a Mirena IUD.  I have been having much more pain in my ovaries that I have chalked up to the PCOS.  I have mentioned this to my OBGYN and she said to call her whenever the pain starts again so she can have an ultrasound done to check the size of the cysts, ovaries, and such.
title: paraneoplastic syndrome
